intro: Ludia ambrensis, commonly known as the red sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-like structure with dense clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Ludia ambrensis is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
